text: __NOTOC__ Walter Wessel (21 April 1892 – 20 July 1943) was a general in the Wehrmacht of Nazi Germany during World War II who commanded the 12th Panzer Division. He was a recipient of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves. Wessel was responsible for the Massacre in Ciepielów, at Ciepielów, Poland. He was killed in an auto accident on 20 July 1943 near Morano, Italy. ==Awards and decorations== * Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves ** Knight's Cross on 15 August 1940 as Oberst and commander of Infanterie- Regiment 15 (mot.)Fellgiebel 2000, p. 360. ** 76th Oak Leaves on 17 February 1942 as Oberst and commander of Infanterie-Regiment 15 (mot.)Fellgiebel 2000, p. 53. ==References== ===Citations=== ===Bibliography=== * * Category:1892 births Category:1943 deaths Category:People from Goslar (district) Category:Lieutenant generals of the German Army (Wehrmacht) Category:German military personnel of World War I Category:Recipients of the clasp to the Iron Cross, 1st class Category:Recipients of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves Category:Road incident deaths in Italy Category:Prussian Army personnel Category:Reichswehr personnel Category:German military personnel killed in World War II Category:People from the Province of Hanover
title: Walter Wessel
